summary: AI agency platform with multi-step build: Lead Management CRM (Step 1), Automation Dashboard with webhook-based Sales System Configuration (Step 2). Features include downloadable exports, invoice/GST quote generation, automation controls, API integrations (Razorpay, WhatsApp Cloud API, OpenRouter/OpenAI, Supabase, Airtable, Resend, Google Sheets, PDF generator), AI Smart Systems, and no-code configurable webhook automation engine.
architectural_notes: All AI systems connect through external automation tools (e.g., Make.com) via webhook URLs — no direct backend API integration
Webhook triggers must use POST method with proper JSON format and Authorization headers; responses must be checked for 200 status
API credentials (Endpoint, Key, WhatsApp Token, Razorpay Key ID/Secret, Email API Key, CRM Webhook URL, Automation Webhook URL) must be persisted and included in all outbound requests
known_issues: API settings fields not saving/sending correctly in Sales System Dashboard
Automation toggles not reliably enabling/disabling features
Webhook triggers not sending correct POST requests to Make.com/external APIs
AI responses (OpenRouter/OpenAI) not displaying in dashboard
Razorpay payment webhooks and WhatsApp auto-reply triggers not functioning correctly
AI Smart Systems 'Launch Tool' buttons not opening functional tool UIs — tools are non-functional placeholders
Sign In button on login screen is non-functional / not working
Services section not displaying catalog correctly and missing version-19-style options/UI

existing_features.title: On the Generators page, when a user clicks 'Launch Tool' for the Service Recommender card, navigate to the Service Recommendation page (/generators/service-recommender) and ensure the page renders a fully functional AI-powered tool UI. The tool must: read the saved API Endpoint and API Key from the centralized config store (localStorage/React context set via SalesSystemConfigDialog); build an OpenAI-compatible POST request with a structured prompt asking for service recommendations based on the user's inputs (business type, budget, goals); display a loading state while awaiting the response; extract and render the AI-generated recommendation text in a clearly styled result area; and show an error message if the API call fails.

On the Generators page, when a user clicks 'Launch Tool' for the Proposal Generator card, navigate to the Proposal Generator page (/generators/proposal) and ensure the page renders a fully functional AI-powered proposal generation UI. The tool must: read the saved API Endpoint and API Key from the centralized config store; accept user inputs for client name, project type, scope, deliverables, timeline, and budget; build an OpenAI-compatible POST request with a prompt instructing the AI to generate a professional proposal; display a loading state; render the full AI-generated proposal text in a formatted result area; and provide a working export (HTML or text download) of the generated proposal.

On the Generators page, when a user clicks 'Launch Tool' for the Smart Pricing Strategy card, navigate to the Pricing Strategy page (/generators/pricing) and ensure the page renders a fully functional AI-powered pricing tool. The tool must: read the saved API Endpoint and API Key from the centralized config store; accept user inputs (service type, base cost, target margin, competitor pricing, urgency/complexity modifiers); send an OpenAI-compatible POST request with a prompt requesting dynamic pricing recommendations and psychological pricing suggestions; display a loading state; render the AI-generated pricing recommendations in a structured result area (alongside or replacing the existing static calculator output); and support exporting the results.

On the Generators page, when a user clicks 'Launch Tool' for the AI Closing Scripts card, create and navigate to a new Closing Scripts page (/generators/closing-scripts). The page must: render a form accepting inputs for prospect name, industry, primary objection, and desired outcome; read the saved API Endpoint and API Key from the centralized config store; build and send an OpenAI-compatible POST request with a prompt requesting tailored closing scripts for the given objection and context; display a loading state; render the AI-generated closing script(s) in a clearly formatted result area; and provide a copy-to-clipboard and/or download option for the generated scripts.

On the Generators page, when a user clicks 'Launch Tool' for the Auto Follow-up Messages card, create and navigate to a new Follow-Up Messages page (/generators/follow-up). The page must: render a form accepting inputs for lead name, pipeline stage, last interaction summary, and follow-up goal; read the saved API Endpoint and API Key from the centralized config store; send an OpenAI-compatible POST request requesting an automated follow-up message sequence (3–5 messages) tailored to the lead's stage; display a loading state; render the AI-generated follow-up sequence in a clearly formatted result area with each message numbered and separated; and provide a copy-to-clipboard or export option.

On the Generators page, when a user clicks 'Launch Tool' for the Smart Lead Qualification card, create and navigate to a new Lead Qualification page (/generators/lead-qualification). The page must: render a form accepting inputs for prospect details (company size, budget range, urgency, decision-maker status, and needs description); read the saved API Endpoint and API Key from the centralized config store; send an OpenAI-compatible POST request with a prompt requesting a qualification score (0–100), tier label (Hot/Warm/Cold), and reasoning; display a loading state; render the AI-generated qualification result including the score, tier badge, and explanation text in a clearly styled result card; and show an error message if the API call fails.

Create a centralized AI config store (using React context backed by localStorage) that exposes the saved API Endpoint and API Key (from the SalesSystemConfigDialog settings). All six AI Generator pages must read from this store to make their API calls. If the API Endpoint or API Key is not configured, each Generator tool page must display a clearly visible banner warning the user that AI credentials are not yet set, with a link or button to open the API settings dialog.

Register the new Closing Scripts (/generators/closing-scripts), Follow-Up Messages (/generators/follow-up), and Lead Qualification (/generators/lead-qualification) routes in the TanStack Router configuration in App.tsx, nested under the authenticated shell route, so they are accessible after login.

Create or overhaul a Sales System Configuration page (accessible from the sidebar/settings) with a form containing the following fields: Webhook URL (general), API Endpoint, API Key, WhatsApp Token, Razorpay Key ID, Razorpay Secret, Email API Key, CRM Webhook URL, and Automation Webhook URL. Each field must have an ON/OFF toggle to enable or disable it. All values must be persisted to localStorage via the centralized AI config context (extending AIConfigContext or creating a unified WebhookConfigContext) and survive page navigation and re-renders. A 'Save Configuration' button must commit all values. A visible connection status indicator (Connected / Not Connected / Not Configured) must appear beside each URL/key field.

Extend the centralized config context (or create a new WebhookConfigContext) to expose all configuration values from REQ-17 (Webhook URL, API Endpoint, API Key, WhatsApp Token, Razorpay Key ID, Razorpay Secret, Email API Key, CRM Webhook URL, Automation Webhook URL) along with their ON/OFF toggle states. All six AI Generator pages and all automation trigger functions must read exclusively from this store. Wrap the app in this provider in App.tsx.

Update all six AI Generator tool pages (Service Recommendation, Proposal Generator, Pricing Strategy, Closing Scripts, Follow-Up Messages, Lead Qualification) so that when a form is submitted, in addition to (or optionally instead of) calling the AI API directly, the form payload is also sent as a POST request to the configured Webhook URL (or Automation Webhook URL) from the centralized config store. The webhook POST must include: Content-Type: application/json header, Authorization header with the saved API Key, and a structured JSON body containing the tool name, all form field values, and a timestamp. The AI-generated response (from the OpenAI-compatible endpoint) must be rendered in the result area of each respective page. If the AI API or webhook call fails, show a user-visible error message specifying which endpoint failed.

Implement five automation triggers that fire webhook POST requests to the configured Automation Webhook URL when their corresponding toggle is ON in the centralized config store: (1) WhatsApp Auto-Reply — fires when a lead is created or updated, sending a payload with lead details and using the WhatsApp Token as Authorization; (2) Proposal Auto-Send — fires when a lead's status is marked 'Qualified', sending lead and proposal data; (3) Lead Follow-Up Sequences — fires on a configurable schedule or manual trigger per lead, sending lead stage and contact info; (4) Payment Confirmation — fires after a Razorpay payment success event (real or simulated), sending payment and lead/order details; (5) Project Onboarding — fires after payment success, sending project creation payload. Each trigger must validate that the Automation Webhook URL is configured and its toggle is ON before attempting the POST. When a trigger fires successfully, log the event; on failure, show a user-visible error.

Fix all automation toggles on the Automation Page so each one reliably enables or disables its feature. Toggle state must be read from and written to the centralized config store (localStorage-backed) so it persists across sessions. When a toggle is turned OFF, its corresponding automation must not fire any webhook calls, API calls, or UI triggers. The five toggles that must work correctly are: WhatsApp Auto-Reply, Proposal Auto-Send, Lead Follow-Up Sequences, Payment Confirmation, and Project Onboarding.

Add a Webhook Log panel visible in the dashboard (e.g., as a collapsible panel or a dedicated /webhook-logs route accessible from the sidebar). This panel must log every outgoing webhook and API request with: timestamp, target URL, event/tool name, request payload summary, HTTP response status, and response body summary. Entries must be color-coded: green for 2xx success, red for errors or non-2xx. The panel must support filtering by event type and status, and provide a 'Clear Logs' button. Logs are stored in-memory or localStorage for the session.

Ensure CSV and PDF exports work correctly across all dashboard modules: Leads, AI Smart Systems results (each generator tool), WhatsApp Logs, Invoices, and the Data Export Center. CSV exports must produce valid comma-separated files with column headers and trigger a browser download. PDF exports (for proposals and invoices) must generate a formatted document and trigger a browser download. Each export button must show a loading/spinner state while generating and display an error message if export fails. Fix any broken export utility functions in exportUtils.ts as needed.

Add real-time connection status indicators for each configured integration on the Sales System Configuration page: API Endpoint, CRM Webhook URL, Automation Webhook URL, WhatsApp (token), and Razorpay (Key ID + Secret). Each indicator must display 'Connected' (green badge) when the last call to that endpoint returned a 2xx response, 'Error' (red badge) when the last call failed or returned non-2xx, and 'Not Configured' (grey badge) when the URL/key field is empty or its toggle is OFF. CRM Webhook URL and Automation Webhook URL must each have a 'Test Connection' button that sends a test POST payload ({ type: 'test', timestamp }) and updates the indicator immediately based on the response.

Populate the Services page with the complete Quick Bee Agency 2026 Master Service Price List. Organise all entries into 7 categories: (1) Web Development Services — 12 services with Student/Business/Premium tiers; (2) App Development Services — 8 services with Student/Business/Premium tiers; (3) AI Automation Services — 8 services with Starter/Growth/Enterprise tiers; (4) Digital Marketing & Growth — 8 services with Student/Business/Premium tiers; (5) Branding & Creative Services — 7 services with Starter/Business/Premium tiers; (6) SaaS & Advanced Tech — 8 services with Business/Advanced/Enterprise tiers; (7) Business Setup & Systems — 6 services with Starter/Growth/Premium tiers. Each service card must display the service name, category, all three pricing tiers with their INR (₹) prices, and the list of 16 features where provided in the user's input. The page must include a category filter/tab bar so users can browse by category. Prices must be formatted in Indian Rupee notation (e.g., ₹1,20,000).

Add the 30 individual service packages (Website Development ₹999, Sales Funnel Setup ₹1,099, WhatsApp Automation ₹1,199, AI Chatbot Setup ₹1,299, Landing Pages ₹1,399, SEO Setup ₹1,499, Social Media Management ₹1,599, Instagram Growth System ₹1,699, Lead Generation System ₹1,799, Branding Kit ₹1,899, Logo Design ₹1,999, Video Editing ₹2,099, AI Content Creation ₹2,199, Email Marketing Setup ₹2,299, LinkedIn Outreach System ₹2,399, E-commerce Store Setup ₹2,499, No-Code App Development ₹2,599, Automation Setup ₹2,699, CRM Setup ₹2,799, AI Proposal Generator ₹2,899, Pricing Strategy Consulting ₹2,999, Funnel Optimization ₹3,099, Copywriting Service ₹3,199, Reels Script Creation ₹3,299, AI Image Generation ₹3,399, T-Shirt POD Setup ₹3,499, Etsy Automation ₹3,599, Affiliate Marketing System ₹3,699, Notion Dashboard Setup ₹3,799, Analytics Dashboard Setup ₹3,899) to the Services page as a separate 'Individual Packages' section or tab. Each package card must show: package name, flat INR price, category, sub-category, and its 16 listed features as a bullet list expandable on click.

Add the Monthly Maintenance & Subscription plans to the Services page as a dedicated 'Maintenance Plans' section or tab. Include all five plan categories: (1) Website Maintenance — Basic (₹999–₹2,999/mo), Business (₹3,999–₹7,999/mo), Premium/AI/3D (₹10,000–₹35,000/mo); (2) App Maintenance — Basic (₹2,999–₹6,999/mo), Growth (₹8,000–₹20,000/mo), Enterprise (₹25,000–₹75,000/mo); (3) AI Automation Maintenance — Basic (₹2,999–₹7,999/mo), Advanced (₹10,000–₹30,000/mo); (4) Marketing & Growth Retainer — Starter (₹4,999–₹12,000/mo), Growth (₹15,000–₹40,000/mo), Premium (₹50,000–₹1,50,000/mo); (5) SaaS & Backend Retainer — Business (₹15,000–₹35,000/mo), Enterprise (₹40,000–₹1,20,000/mo). Each plan card must list its included features as provided in the user's input.

Add the 3 Master Agency Plans (Spark, Surge, Titan) to the Services page as a prominently styled 'Agency Plans' section or tab. Display: Spark Plan (₹4,999–₹25,000, Student/Beginner/Idea Stage), Surge Plan (₹30,000–₹1,20,000, Local & National Business Growth), Titan Plan (₹1,50,000–₹5,00,000+, National/Global/Enterprise Clients). Style each plan as a highlighted pricing card with a distinct colour badge (green for Spark, blue for Surge, purple for Titan) matching the emoji indicators in the source data.

On every service card, pricing tier card, maintenance plan card, individual package card, and agency plan card on the Services page, add a direct 'Buy Now' or 'Select & Pay' button. When clicked, this button must: (1) add the selected service/plan at the chosen price tier to the cart (using the existing useCart hook), then navigate to the CheckoutPage; OR (2) if Razorpay is configured in the centralized config store, initiate a Razorpay payment flow directly for the selected item's price. For tiered services (Student/Business/Premium), display a tier selector (radio buttons or segmented control) on the card so the user can choose which tier price to purchase before clicking the button. The selected tier and price must be passed through to the cart/checkout.

Fix the Sign In with Internet Identity button on LoginPage (frontend/src/pages/LoginPage.tsx) so that clicking it correctly triggers the Internet Identity authentication flow via the useInternetIdentity hook. The button must: (1) be properly bound to its click handler and not disabled by default; (2) call the login() function from useInternetIdentity when clicked; (3) display a visible loading/spinner state while authentication is in progress (isLoggingIn state); (4) redirect the authenticated user to the appropriate dashboard route upon successful login (using TanStack Router navigate); (5) show a user-visible error message if authentication fails or is cancelled by the user. Ensure the BootstrapGate component (frontend/src/components/bootstrap/BootstrapGate.tsx) does not block the login button from being clickable before the actor is fully ready, or that the LoginPage bypasses the gate appropriately so unauthenticated users can always access the sign-in flow.

Fix the Sign In with Internet Identity button on LoginPage (frontend/src/pages/LoginPage.tsx) so that clicking it correctly triggers the Internet Identity authentication flow. The button must: (1) be properly bound to its click handler and never disabled by default; (2) call the login() function from useInternetIdentity when clicked; (3) display a visible loading/spinner state while authentication is in progress; (4) redirect the authenticated user to the appropriate dashboard route upon successful login using TanStack Router navigate; (5) show a user-visible error message if authentication fails or is cancelled. Ensure BootstrapGate (frontend/src/components/bootstrap/BootstrapGate.tsx) does not block the login button before the actor is fully ready — unauthenticated users must always be able to access and click the Sign In button regardless of actor initialization state.

Fix the Services page (frontend/src/pages/ServicesPage.tsx) so it correctly displays the full service catalog. The page must render all tabs and sections — Master Services (7 categories with tiered pricing), Individual Packages (30 items), Maintenance Plans, and Agency Plans (Spark/Surge/Titan) — exactly as they appeared in the working version 19 UI. Specifically: (1) restore the category filter/tab bar at the top so users can browse by category; (2) ensure all service cards, package cards, maintenance plan cards, and agency plan cards are visible and not blank/empty; (3) restore the tier selector (radio buttons or segmented control) on tiered service cards; (4) restore the 'Buy Now' / 'Select & Pay' button on every card that adds the item to the cart via useCart and navigates to CheckoutPage, or initiates a Razorpay flow if Razorpay is configured; (5) ensure search/filter inputs work correctly to filter the displayed cards; (6) ensure expandable feature lists on individual package cards open on click. All data must be sourced from the existing static data files (masterServiceCatalog.ts, individualPackages.ts, maintenancePlans.ts, agencyPlans.ts).

Rewrite LoginPage (frontend/src/pages/LoginPage.tsx) so the Sign In with Internet Identity button is fully functional. The button must: (1) never be disabled by default; (2) call the login() function from the useInternetIdentity hook when clicked; (3) show a visible loading/spinner state while isLoggingIn is true; (4) on successful authentication, use TanStack Router's navigate to redirect the user to the appropriate dashboard route (/dashboard or role-based equivalent); (5) display a user-visible inline error message if authentication fails or the user cancels the flow. Remove any condition or prop that could prevent the button from being clickable before the actor is initialized.

Update BootstrapGate (frontend/src/components/bootstrap/BootstrapGate.tsx) so it does not block or disable the login UI before the actor and identity are fully initialized. Unauthenticated users must be able to see and interact with the LoginPage — including clicking the Sign In button — regardless of actor initialization state. BootstrapGate should only gate authenticated/protected content, not the login page itself.

Ensure that once the user is authenticated via Internet Identity, their identity and role are used to redirect them to the correct dashboard route. Admin users should be redirected to /admin-dashboard (or equivalent), manager users to /manager-dashboard, client users to /client-dashboard, and any other authenticated user to /dashboard. If the role cannot be determined yet, redirect to /dashboard as a safe default. This redirect must happen automatically in LoginPage after login() resolves successfully.

Perform a full rewrite of frontend/src/pages/LoginPage.tsx. The Sign In with Internet Identity button must: (1) never be disabled or have any condition preventing it from being clicked; (2) call the login() function from the useInternetIdentity hook on click; (3) display a visible loading spinner while isLoggingIn is true; (4) on successful authentication (identity becomes non-null / isAuthenticated becomes true), use TanStack Router's useNavigate to redirect to /dashboard (or /admin-dashboard, /manager-dashboard, /client-dashboard based on role if available); (5) display a user-visible inline error message if login() throws or authentication is cancelled. Remove every guard, disabled prop, or conditional render that could block the button before the actor is initialized.

Rewrite frontend/src/components/bootstrap/BootstrapGate.tsx so it never blocks or visually disables the LoginPage UI. BootstrapGate must detect when the current route is the login page (or when the user is unauthenticated) and render children directly without any loading spinner, overlay, or disabled wrapper. The gate must only intercept navigation to authenticated/protected routes. Unauthenticated users must always see and interact with the full login UI regardless of actor or identity initialization state.

Audit and fix the useInternetIdentity hook integration in LoginPage. Ensure the hook is imported from the correct immutable path (frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts), that the destructured login function and isLoggingIn / isAuthenticated / identity values are correctly consumed, and that a useEffect watches isAuthenticated / identity to trigger role-based navigation after login resolves. If the hook returns a promise from login(), await it before checking authentication state. Confirm the InternetIdentityProvider is wrapping the app in frontend/src/main.tsx so the hook has access to its context.

Ensure role-based post-login redirect works correctly in LoginPage. After login() resolves and the user is authenticated, query the user's role from the backend actor (or from the existing useQueries hooks). Redirect admin users to /admin-dashboard, manager users to /manager-dashboard, client users to /client-dashboard, and any other authenticated user or unresolved role to /dashboard as the safe default. If the role query is still loading, redirect to /dashboard immediately rather than waiting indefinitely.

new_feature_requests.summary: Fix API settings fields (Endpoint, Key, WhatsApp Token, Razorpay Keys, Email API Key, CRM/Automation Webhook URLs) so values are properly saved and sent in requests
Fix webhook triggers (form submission, lead qualification, payment success, project creation) to send POST requests with correct JSON format and headers
Add error messages, logging, and response status checks (200 success confirmation) across all webhook and API calls
Fix automation toggles so they truly enable/disable each feature (WhatsApp Auto-Reply, Proposal Auto-Send, Lead Follow-Up, Payment Confirmation, Project Onboarding)
Ensure AI responses from OpenRouter/OpenAI display correctly in the dashboard for all AI Smart Systems modules
Validate Razorpay payment webhooks and WhatsApp auto-reply triggers function correctly end-to-end
Ensure PDF and CSV exports generate properly across all dashboard modules

Fix the API settings configuration form so that all fields — API Endpoint, API Key, WhatsApp Token, Razorpay Key ID, Razorpay Secret, Email API Key, CRM Webhook URL, and Automation Webhook URL — are properly persisted to state/storage and included in all outgoing requests. Values must survive component re-renders and page navigation. Use a centralized config store (e.g., React context or persistent state via localStorage) so every module can read and use these values reliably.

Fix all webhook trigger functions (form submission, lead qualification, payment success, project creation) to correctly send HTTP POST requests with proper JSON body and headers. Each trigger must include: Content-Type: application/json header, Authorization header using the saved API Key where required, and a structured JSON payload relevant to the event type. Use the saved CRM Webhook URL for CRM events and Automation Webhook URL for automation events from the API settings store.

Add comprehensive error handling, logging, and response status validation to all webhook and API calls. For every outgoing request: catch network errors and show a user-visible error message specifying which webhook/API failed, log request details (URL, payload, timestamp) and response details (status, body) to a visible in-dashboard Webhook Log panel, confirm HTTP 200/2xx as success and display a success indicator, show a distinct error state for non-2xx responses including the status code and response message.

Fix automation toggles on the Automation Page so each one truly enables or disables its corresponding feature. When a toggle is OFF, its automation must not fire (no webhook calls, no API calls, no UI triggers). When ON, the automation must be active. The following toggles must be fixed: WhatsApp Auto-Reply, Proposal Auto-Send (when lead is qualified), Lead Follow-Up Sequences, Payment Confirmation via Razorpay webhook, and Project Onboarding after payment success. Toggle state must persist across sessions.

Fix the AI Smart Systems modules (Service Recommendation, Proposal Generator, Pricing Strategy, Closing Scripts, Follow-Up Messages, Lead Qualification) so that AI responses from OpenRouter/OpenAI are correctly fetched and displayed in the dashboard. Each module must: build the correct API request using the saved API Endpoint and API Key, send the prompt with proper OpenAI-compatible JSON body format, handle the response and extract the generated text, and render the AI response in the relevant result area of the page.

Fix Razorpay payment webhook handling and WhatsApp auto-reply triggers. For Razorpay: when a payment success event occurs (or is simulated), fire the Automation Webhook URL with a structured payment payload and update the lead/project status accordingly. For WhatsApp Auto-Reply: when the WhatsApp Auto-Reply toggle is ON and a lead is created or updated, send a POST request to the saved Automation Webhook URL with WhatsApp message payload (using the saved WhatsApp Token as authorization). Both flows must validate the webhook URL is configured before attempting.

Ensure PDF and CSV exports work correctly across all dashboard modules including Leads, AI Smart Systems results, WhatsApp Logs, Invoices, and the Data Export Center. Fix any broken export functions: CSV exports must produce valid comma-separated files with headers and download to the user's browser; PDF exports must generate a formatted document and trigger a browser download. Each export button must show a loading state while generating and an error message if it fails.

Add a real-time connection status indicator for each configured integration (API Endpoint, CRM Webhook URL, Automation Webhook URL, WhatsApp, Razorpay). Each indicator must show 'Connected' (green) when the last call to that endpoint returned a 2xx response, 'Error' (red) when the last call failed, and 'Not Configured' (grey) when the URL/key is empty. Add a 'Test Connection' button for CRM Webhook URL and Automation Webhook URL that sends a test POST payload and updates the indicator in real time.

Make each AI Generator tool (Service Recommender, Proposal Generator, Pricing Strategy, Closing Scripts, Follow-Up Messages, Lead Qualification) launch a functional tool UI when clicking 'Launch Tool', with working AI-powered functionality using the saved API Endpoint and API Key.

Add full Quick Bee Agency 2026 Master Service Price List to the Services page, organized by category (Web Dev, App Dev, AI Automation, Digital Marketing, Branding, SaaS & Tech, Business Systems) with tiered pricing (Student/Business/Premium/Enterprise), monthly maintenance plans, master agency plans (Spark/Surge/Titan), and individual service cards with 16 features each — all with direct payment/purchase selection via Razorpay
Fix the Sign In button on the login screen so it correctly authenticates and redirects the user

Fix the Sign In button on the LoginPage (frontend/src/pages/LoginPage.tsx) so that clicking it correctly triggers the Internet Identity authentication flow, waits for authentication to complete, and then redirects the authenticated user to the appropriate dashboard route. The button must show a loading/spinner state while the authentication is in progress. If authentication fails or is cancelled, display a user-visible error message. Ensure the button is not disabled or unbound from its click handler.
Fix the Services section to display the catalog/service list correctly and restore the UI options/layout as they appeared in version 19
